Declarations for functions used for 3D egomotion estimation. Code for computing Egomotion from correspondence probability distributions. the function compute3Dmotion provides the entire public interface. print3Dmotion is a trivial function which prints out the motion parameters in a MotionParameters struct. void print3Dmotion (MotionParameters egomotion)

Detailed Description

Declarations for functions used for 3D egomotion estimation. Code for computing Egomotion from correspondence probability distributions. the function compute3Dmotion provides the entire public interface. print3Dmotion is a trivial function which prints out the motion parameters in a MotionParameters struct.

Author:
Justin Domke

Function Documentation

MotionParameters compute3Dmotion (  OvImageAdapter &  image1,
OvImageAdapter &  image2,
float  f,
float  pp_x,
float  pp_y,
int  numpoints,
int  numsearches
) 
 

Get the egomotion from two calibrated images. 

    MotionParameters egomotion = compute3Dmotion(image1, image2, f, pp_x, pp_y, numpoints, numsearches);
Parameters:
image1 the first image
image2 the second image
f the focal length, in pixels
pp_x the x component of the focal length, in pixels, from the left side of the image
pp_y the y component of the focal length, in pixels, from the left side of the image
numpoints how many correspondence probability distributions to use (default 500) -- more is both slower and more accurate
numsearches how many nonlinear searches to use when attempting to maximize egomotion probability (default 100) -- more is both slower and more robust
Returns:
a MotionParameters structure containing computed 3D motion

void print3Dmotion (  MotionParameters  egomotion  ) 
 

Print out the motion parameters for this particular estimate. i.e. 

    print3Dmotion(egomotion);
Parameters:
egomotion is a MotionParameters struct containing the motion parameters
See also:
compute3Dmotion
